scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of four typescript sets of poetry by Gay Allis Rose Clifford(1943-), all written between 1978 and 1984, when the effects of a cerebral hemorrhage prevented her from further work. Eighty-nine of these poems have been published in Poems by Gay Clifford Introduced by Germaine Greer(Special Collections PR 6053 .L492P6 1990). Each poem includes the date of composition and revision with an occasional autograph change or correction.

Having obtained a First Class degree and a Bachelor's of Philosophy at Oxford in 1964, Clifford pursued a career in English literature at the University of Warwick, the University of Virginia, Emory in Atlanta, and at the University College of London (summer 1978). She also wrote Notes on the Merchant of Veniceand The Transformations of Allegory(1974).
